title: I would like to learn saxophone. Where should I start from? I have no prior knowledge of music at all. - Quora

response.answer_text: To learn music, as you say, would involve learning harmony, and the sax is not the best place to start, unfortunately. Depending on how you feel about the instruments, I recommend either keyboard or guitar. To play any instrument well is not easy. You have to find one that feels right to you, but the ones I mention are a good window into the world of harmony.  (Also, you can't sing with a mouthpiece in your face, but maybe that's another issue.)   Guitar is pretty cool.  You don't have to worry so much about the sound like on sax - it takes a lot of work to get the sound right.  You can hang out with other players on a guitar and share and learn together. Sax players often feel quite left out. Then, after you get it together a bit, you could pick up a horn and see what you can do.

The Alto Saxophone is reasonably sized and common. The Tenor saxophone is the most common in recordings but is bigger, heavier and more expensive. They are all fingered the same but are different key signature, lots of fun to play too!
